Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (fired reddish); exterior: painted decoration of frieze of geese to left (head, wing and feet of first goose missing; only tip of tail feathers of second remaining); rising roundel, swastika and rosettes as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than as by the painter of the bowl, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74, p. 237, no. 172, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0376) (phase 2)
